content:
Here is the cleaned-up text:

FlexCard States

FlexCards have states. Each state displays a list of fields, a data source, and one or more actions. You can also associate a state with one or more flyouts.

FlexCard states enable presentation of different CRM interactions per state. For example, closed cases have reopening actions, while escalated cases are styled differently and have an action to view the case.

In addition to adding elements depending on the state, you can set conditions to determine if, when, and how data displays on a FlexCard.

You can enable a Blank Card State to display information when no data is returned from the configured data source.

Customize each card by its state to display various clickable actions, information, and optional visual cues.

Add a State to a FlexCard
Add a state to a FlexCard to present different interactions and layouts based on specified conditions. Each FlexCard has a default state that cannot be deleted.
Clone a FlexCard
Create an identical copy of a FlexCard with the Clone feature in the FlexCard Designer.
Add Conditions to a FlexCard State
Set conditions to determine if, when, and how data displays on a FlexCard.

FlexCards have states. Each state displays a list of fields, a data source, and one or more actions. You can also associate a state with one or more flyouts.

You can customize each card by its state to display various clickable actions, information, and optional visual cues.

Add Conditions to a FlexCard State
FlexCard states enable the presentation of different CRM interactions for each state. Set conditions to determine if, when, and how data displays on a FlexCard.
FlexCards State Properties
This page contains lists of available FlexCards State element properties.
title: Understanding FlexCard States in OmniStudio
